title: Process Substitution
description: Process substitution is a technique in shell programming that allows you to use the input or output of a process as if it were a file. It provides a way to chain the output of multiple commands to another command, or to process the input to a command from another source. This tutorial will walk you through the concept of process substitution with examples and steps.

verify.hint: You need to practice coding in LabEx VM.
